results.name: Cloud Run hosting decision
results.answer: We chose Cloud Run for API hosting because it scales to zero when idle, keeping costs near zero during development [N1][N2]. The service also auto-scales up to 10 instances under load [N1][N2].

results.name: Chunk size configuration
results.answer: The target chunk size is 450 characters with 75 character overlap for context continuity [N3][N4]. After testing, 450 character chunks with 75 character overlap perform best [N1][N2]. The chunking strategy uses sentence-aware splitting to preserve meaning [N1][N2]. 450 character chunks had the best

results.name: Embedding dimensions
results.answer: The embeddings are 768-dimensional [N1][N2]. The Chunks collection stores embeddings as 768 floats [N7][N8].

results.name: Rate limit configuration
results.answer: The API rate limits in production are 60 requests per minute per tenant [N1][N2]. The chat endpoint has a 30 second timeout [N1][N2]. The maximum query length is 2000 characters [N1][N2]. The rate limiting is implemented using an in-memory rate limiting with a sliding window algorithm [N1][N2]. The

results.name: Sprint 1 target date
results.answer: The target launch date for the MVP is January 15, 2025 [N3][N4]. The MVP will include basic notes CRUD, simple search, and a chat endpoint [N3][N4]. The team consists of 2 backend devs and 1 frontend dev [N3][N4]. The budget is $500/month for cloud costs [N3][N4]. The Q1 2025 roadmap includes launch

results.name: TypeScript decision
results.answer: The backend uses TypeScript with Express.js [N1][N2]. TypeScript was chosen over Python Flask due to team familiarity and strong typing [N1][N2].

results.name: Database choice
results.answer: Firestore is used for persistence [N3][N4]. It is serverless and integrates seamlessly with Cloud Run [N3][N4].

results.name: Pricing decision
results.answer: The pricing will be $9.99/month for Pro [N1][N2], and the free tier is limited to 100 notes [N1][N2]. The target users are researchers, students, and writers [N1][N2]. The focus is on individual knowledge workers rather than enterprise [N1][N2]. The main risks include API cost overruns, user adoptio

results.name: Architecture summary
results.answer: The architecture uses Cloud Run for API hosting and Firestore for persistence [N1][N2]. The backend uses TypeScript with Express.js, while the frontend uses React with Vite [N3][N4]. Key points: * Cloud Run was chosen for API hosting because it scales to zero when idle and auto-scales up to 10 insta

results.name: Q1 roadmap phases
results.answer: Here are the phases in the Q1 roadmap: * Phase 1 (Jan) - Launch MVP with core features [N1][N2]. The target launch date for the MVP is January 15, 2025 [N5][N6]. results.name: Team members and tasks
results.answer: Sarah completed authentication integration [N1][N2], Emma finished initial UI mockups [N1][N2], and Mike is blocked on Vertex AI setup and needs project permissions [N1][N2]. The team's next week focus is on end-to-end testing [N1][N2]. The team is working towards completing an MVP with basic notes

results.name: RAG implementation details
results.answer: The retrieval system in the RAG pipeline uses hybrid search combining vector similarity (cosine) with keyword matching [N1][N2]. Embeddings are 768-dimensional using text-embedding-004 [N1][N2]. Chunks target 450 characters with 75 char overlap for context continuity [N1][N2].

results.name: Competitor comparison
results.answer: Notion AI uses GPT-4 and costs $10/user/month [N1][N2]. Mem.ai focuses on memory graph and costs $15/month [N1][N2]. Obsidian Copilot is local-first and has a one-time cost of $50 [N1][N2]. Our advantage is simplicity and citation transparency [N1][N2]. Main risks are API cost overruns [N3][N4]. Mit

results.name: Risk and mitigation
results.answer: The main risks are API cost overruns, user adoption, and competition [N1][N2]. Mitigation strategies include strict rate limits, a freemium model, and focusing on simplicity as a differentiator [N1][N2].
